description: 共同科英文（一）課程為一學年課程，每學期兩學分，係為非英語系學生所開設的課程。目標在幫助大一學生活用中學時期所累積的英語知識，提昇英語聽、說、讀、寫整體的溝通能力。為達此目標，本課程要求教師盡量用英語上課，努力營造一個豐富的英語環境，讓學生不但有充分機會以英語參與課堂活動，且樂於使用英語與同學及老師溝通。

提升學生英語學習動機及自主學習興趣
syllabus:
**The Objectives:**

This course is designed to support college freshmen in their use of **English language in an academic context** through **intensive and extensive reading** and **skill/strategy training**. In addition, it also aims to build student proficiency in the output language skills—**writing and speaking**—through a variety of activities that integrate all four language skills.

Overall, the objectives of this class will focus on (1) **developing** **effective English reading skills**, (2) **improving fluency in critically expressing ideas** in both oral and written forms in English, and (3) **introducing autonomous self-study skills** for future learning. Therefore, there will be a five-pronged approach to the course:

**1) Firstly,** the **course textbook** and **online practice website** consist of a purposefully structured skills and strategies program to **propel language learning** and **create independent learners**. Furthermore, the textbook helps improve **vocabulary learning, reading proficiency** and **develop practical critical thinking.**

**2) Secondly,** over the course of the first-half of the semester, students will undertake a **performance task-based project**, in which task groups, of no more than 4 students per group, are asked to **investigate areas and topics that are of interest to them**, and then **present their work to the class** via film, audio, or live performance. This can include a short film, online video, radio show, podcast, play or a live play/skit or performance (e.g. music, magic, comedy).

**3) Thirdly,** students are expected to read extensively to improve their English reading, especially online and library **Lexile books.** There will be a **Lexile Test** in both semesters to assess each student’s improvement in reading.

**3) Fourthly,** students will need to do at least **_10 hours_ of** **autonomous learning** in total this semester. These experiences must be **proven or recorded** and handed in at the end of the semester**.**

**4) Finally**, in the second half of the course, there will be a **writing workshop** for which students will be asked to write **a short critical essay** based on class work.

**N.B: All course elements will be evaluated and assessed for final grading.**

**Guidelines and Requirements: The Rules**

1.  **Punctual attendance** is essential. Talk to or email me if you can’t attend class or are late for class.
2.  This is a **Flip Class**. Homework and previewing must be done **before class** for the course to work properly.
3.  Actively **participate in class discussions**.
4.  You need to **submit work _several times_** during the semester. Task drafts, assignments, homework, and essays **must be done and be on time**.
5.  Smartphones, tablets, etc, must be **turned off** unless needed in class.
6.  **No eating** during class, but drinks are allowed.
7.  **English Practice**: Students should practice their English every chance they get, e.g. **Self-Access Room** (Main campus 樸101), **Workshops** (Main campus 樸102), **English Chat Room** and **NTNU Competitions (both on FLED website)**. You use record this work for your auto-learning.
8.  **Grades will be downgraded** for failure to attend class without reason, excessive lateness, lack of participation or failure to do homework or assignments on time. 

**Grading Policy****: The Business!**

Final grades are based and assessed on performance in the following:

1.  Attendance and Participation: 10%
2.  Book Review and Online Reading: 10%
3.  Lexile Reading Test 10%
4.  Performance Task: 20%
5.  Midterm and Final Quiz: 15% each
6.  Auto-learning Portfolio: 10%
7.  Essay 10%
